text:
‚ÄúComics are able to do things that texts can‚Äôt. They allow cross-communication between cultures through images ‚Äì sometimes without the need for language translation." üìö

A new module on City's English MA led by Dr Dominic Davies will allow students to make more choices in their education by looking at refugee comics as well as traditional texts and novels.

Read more üëâ https://www.city.ac.uk/news/2019/september/students-become-literary-critics-with-comics

If you're coming to City for the first time today, welcome! üëã

Look out for our friendly Student Ambassadors (wearing red t-shirts.) They can help you find your way and show you around once you arrive. 

Our students will be taking over our Instagram Stories and answering your questions, so make sure to follow us on there:
üì∑cityuniversitylondon

In celebration of Black History Month, we've teamed up with City Students' Union and will be holding a number of events throughout October. To kick off the celebrations, there will be an exhibition taking place in the Pavilion from 11am on Monday 7th October ‚ú®
